newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: KL tin up 24 cents to four-month high.
newsitem.headline: KL tin up 24 cents to four-month high.

text.p: Malaysia's tin price ended 24 cents up to a four-month high of 15.26 ringgit ($6.04) a kg in tandem with an overnight surge on the London Metal Exchange (LME), traders said.
"There was good buying from European, Japanese and local interests after the strong LME in the last few days," said a trader.

There were bids for 242 tonnes against offers of 111, leading to a turnover of 185 tonnes against 113 tonnes on Tuesday. The local price fetched a premium of $35 against the LME, compared to a discount of $10 previously.
